p: the "collaborative digital canvas" was a project i did for university in a course taught by Prof. Dr. Robert Strzebkowski. i had to come up with an idea, do all that boring project-planing stuff and then basically start coding.
the idea was to implement a collaboration tool that lets you draw on a canvas, chat and share your webcam stream.

i decided to code the frontend in flash, the backend in java and used the flash media server for centralized streaming. in order to exchange drawing data as fast as possible, i came up with a byte-level protocol to keep the clients updated.
today i would probably do a lot of things very differently, starting with the technologies i used, but in the end i did learn a lot working on that thing.
the code is now on github.
